metadata.title: CVE-2016-9400 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The CClient::ProcessServerPacket method in engine/client/client.cpp inTeeworlds before 0.6.4 allows remote servers to write to arbitrary physicalmemory locations and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involvingsnap handling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

teeworlds - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
teeworlds-data - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
teeworlds-server - 0.6.4+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: teeworlds package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.4+dfsg-1').
